title: Using 1 as shutdown port with Windows service works, but prints error message
description: Specify <Server port="1" in server.xml. That can be used to differentiate the two use cases. There could be improvements on how to stop Tomcat. System.exit(0) would work regardless of all that. I suppose that jsvc may show the same behaviour, but I have not tried.
OB: The bug report does not provide any information about the observed behavior.
EB: If the described behavior is accurate, it would be better to use the wait(10000) method instead of sleep(10000) in StandardServer.await(). This would allow the thread to be woken up by a notifyAll() call or an interrupt() call (if the specific thread is known).
SR: The bug report does not provide any steps to reproduce the issue.
